_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
FAIRMONT PRODUCTS

Description of Facility and Regulated Substance Handled:
Fairmont Products, Belleville, PA processes cultured dairy products.  The facility utilizes anhydrous ammonia as a refrigerant to maintain the proper temperature of cultured dairy products within the facility.  Anhydrous ammonia is an effective refrigerant that has been used for many years by this food processing facility.  Ammonia is normally a gas at ambient temperatures but is handled as a gas liquefied under pressure.  The refrigeration system consists of a vessel, evaporators, compressors, piping, and valves.

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies:  Fairmont Products is committed to promoting safety for the plant, its employees and the surrounding area.  The facility is complying with OSHA Process Safety Management Standard (PSM), Title 29 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) 1910.119, and EPA?s Risk Management Program regulations (RMP), Title 40 CFR Part 68.  The purpose of these programs is to ensure that the refrigeration system is operated safely in order to prevent releases of ammonia from the system.  In addition, these programs serve to develop procedures to minimize releases in the event that they do occur and to outline appropriate emergency response steps to take in the event of a release.

Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps:  As a part of its PSM Program, Fairmont Products has established numerous programs that serve to prevent accidental releases of ammonia.  
These programs include:
Process Safety Information
Process Hazard Analysis
Operating Procedures
Training
Mechanical Integrity
Management of Change
Pre-Startup Review
Compliance Audits
Incident Investigations
Employee Participation
Hot Work Permits
Contractor Safety

Emergency Response Information:  As a part of the PSM Program, the facility maintains an Emergency Response Plan that was prepared in order to improve responsiveness to an eme

rgency incident, and to increase the reliability of actions taken during an incident.  The plan includes all aspects of emergency response including adequate first aid and medical treatment, evacuations, notification of local emergency response agencies as well as the public.  

In the event of an emergency involving the ammonia system, it is the policy of the facility to request assistance as necessary by calling 911 which will notify the Mifflin County LEPC and the Local Township Police Department.  In addition, the Mifflin County LEPC has included Fairmont Products in its local emergency response planning.

Five Year Accident History:  Fairmont Products has had an excellent record of preventing accidental releases over the last 5 years.  Due to our stringent release prevention policies, there has been no accidental release during this period.  In addition, the facility will continue to operate and maintain the system in accordance with IIAR Guidance and will continue to implement its OSHA PSM Program in conjunction with the Risk Management Program.  

FAIRMONT PRODUCTS EXECUTIVE SUMMARY.
